description: As of today the first handful of commits have landed in LLVM Git ahead of next year's LLVM 20.0 for beginning to enable the AMDGPU compiler back-end for "GFX950", the next iteration of the CDNA family for Instinct accelerators...
title: AMD Begins Adding "GFX950" GPU Support To LLVM For Next CDNA Accelerator

description: The Linux kernel Workqueue (WQ) is used for handling asynchronous process execution. For the past many years there has been an upper limit on the number of workqueue execution contexts per CPU at 512, but with Linux 6.13 that is being quadrupled to a limit of 2048...
title: Linux 6.13 Quadrupling Workqueue Concurrency Limit

description: Over the past year we have seen Canonical engineers focus more on optimizing the performance potential of Ubuntu Linux. With Ubuntu 25.04 they are now using the -O3 compiler optimization level by default and there has been other efforts like better performance tooling on Ubuntu and frame pointers by default. Another area they have been exploring is making use of Profile Guided Optimizations (PGO) for faster performance in certain scenarios...
title: Ubuntu Praises 5~7% PGO Compiler Optimization Performance Benefits

description: All of the block subsystem changes were sent out today for the in-development Linux 6.13 kernel, including a prominent set of NVMe additions...
title: Linux 6.13 Rolling Out NVMe 2.1 Support & NVMe Rotational Media

description: At the beginning of November I wrote about AMD Linux engineers posting Linux patches enabling a new "ERAPS" feature for Zen 5. ERAPS wasn't talked about by AMD at the Zen 5 launches of the Ryzen 9000 / Ryzen AI 300 series or with the more recent EPYC 9005 "Turin" launch but when enabled, the Enhanced Return Address Prediction Security feature can help deliver some additional gains on new AMD Zen 5 systems by allowing some existing software security mitigations to be avoided. Here are some preliminary comparison benchmarks showing the benefit in affected workloads for using ERAPS on Linux with AMD Zen 5.
title: New AMD ERAPS Feature Yields Additional Performance Gains On Zen 5

description: GCC 15 feature development is now officially over with entering stage three development to focus on fixing compiler bugs...
title: GCC 15 Compiler Development Shifts From Features To Bug Fixing

description: With last month's Raspberry Pi OS update they now default to Wayland on all Raspberry Pi models alongside various other operating system improvements. Out today is the latest iteration of the Debian-based Raspberry Pi OS with software updates and other changes...
title: Raspberry Pi OS Now Defaults To 512MB Swap, Updates Labwc Compositor

description: Following AMX-FP8 support, AMX-AVX512, and other new Intel CPU ISA features being added to the LLVM Clang 20 compiler codebase, the Intel Diamond Rapids target is now upstreamed for allowing "-march=diamondrapids" targeting for these next-generation Xeon processors...
title: LLVM Clang 20 Merges Intel Diamond Rapids Support With "-march=diamondrapids"

description: DXVK 2.5 released one week ago with better video memory management handling, various Direct3D additions, and more. DXVK 2.5.1 is out today to fix a "major regression" as well as a few other bugs...
title: DXVK 2.5.1 Released To Fix A Major Regression & Other Bugs

description: Along with the early Bcachefs pull request for Linux 6.13, SUSE engineer David Sterba submitted all of the Btrfs file-system feature updates in an early pull request for this next kernel version. Btrfs is seeing new performance optimizations and other enhancements for Linux 6.13...
title: Btrfs With Linux 6.13 Delivers Performance Improvements & Other Features

description: The third weekly beta release of FreeBSD 14.2 is now available for testing ahead of the planned stable release in early December. Besides a few fixes notable to FreeBSD 14.2-BETA3 is that they are now putting out OCI container images among their release media...
title: FreeBSD 14.2 Beta 3 Released - FreeBSD Now Publishing OCI Container Images

description: The ARM64 (AArch64) architecture changes have been submitted for the now-open Linux 6.13 merge window...
title: Linux 6.13 For ARM64 Brings GCS Support & Protected VMs With Arm CCA
